channel.title: Handeling your jar files
channel.description:
A new problem I have come across in 'theory'. I realized when my loader loads runescape, it's using a different class to load then what I have injected in my classpath. Just thinking about how this is, confuses me.
Basically I have two jars then. One jar that had loaded runescape, then the jar I have modified. So from what I am perceiving I would need to modify the game client through a whole nother jar. I just don't see how that is possible. I'm just asking for a quick explanation, then I'll lock.

item.title: Handeling your jar files
item.dc:creator: @packersfa52 packersfa52
item.description:
@packersfa52 wrote:

Pwnd:

I handle my jar files very carefully.

Bubble wrap?

I’ll send you a message Ollie, along with my temporary solution I was using.

Read full topic

item.title: Handeling your jar files
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

you would basically ‘fool’ the loader into thinking it is loading from the resource provided and because of your classloader hack it will mean that when the ‘real’ class is called for loading, you can swap it with your own.

If you want me to write you an example send me a private message.

Read full topic

item.title: Handeling your jar files
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

I handle my jar files very carefully.

Read full topic

item.title: Handeling your jar files
item.dc:creator: @packersfa52 packersfa52
item.description:
@packersfa52 wrote:

Ollie:

you need to modify the loader so that when it loads classes, it would use your custom class loader which loads from the modified jar.

So would I inject my modified classes from one jar into the one I got at runtime?

Read full topic

item.title: Handeling your jar files
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

you need to modify the loader so that when it loads classes, it would use your custom class loader which loads from the modified jar.

Read full topic

item.title: Handeling your jar files

item.description:
@frank wrote:

why would anyone seriously consider reflection these days

Read full topic

item.title: Handeling your jar files
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:2, topic:392140”]I really don’t understand what you are asking, it sounds like you probably just need a good nights sleep.

You basically have 2 options for this, my preferred one being the second:

  1. Have 2 programs, an ‘updater’ that modifies the runescape jar, and then your loader that loads the modified jar.
  2. Your loader modifies the runescape jar and runs it during runtime, for an example of this, have a look at cherokee, in particular this file:
    http://cherokeeengine.svn.sourceforge.net/viewvc/cherokeeengine/src/com/cherokee/rs/rs2/RS2Setup.java?revision=33&view=markup
    http://cherokeeengine.svn.sourceforge.net/viewvc/cherokeeengine/src/com/cherokee/rs/rs2/ClassEditor.java?revision=33&view=markup[/quote]
  3. Don’t modify the jar and just reflect the fields.

Read full topic

item.title: Handeling your jar files
item.dc:creator: @packersfa52 packersfa52
item.description:
@packersfa52 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:2, topic:392140”]I really don’t understand what you are asking, it sounds like you probably just need a good nights sleep.

You basically have 2 options for this, my preferred one being the second:

  1. Have 2 programs, an ‘updater’ that modifies the runescape jar, and then your loader that loads the modified jar.
  2. Your loader modifies the runescape jar and runs it during runtime, for an example of this, have a look at cherokee, in particular this file:
    http://cherokeeengine.svn.sourceforge.net/viewvc/cherokeeengine/src/com/cherokee/rs/rs2/RS2Setup.java?revision=33&view=markup
    http://cherokeeengine.svn.sourceforge.net/viewvc/cherokeeengine/src/com/cherokee/rs/rs2/ClassEditor.java?revision=33&view=markup[/quote]

I do need some sleep, but you got the gist of my problem. What I tried to do was make Class RSClient, dl the runescape jar in this file, access it in my loader and canvas injector, but after I modified the jar with my canvas injector it would refuse to load. An implementing class error. I’ll get back on it tomorrow with some rested eyes.

Thanks for the help ^.^

Read full topic
